Veterans Reimbursement for Emergency Ambulance Services Act
VREASA
To amend title 38, United States Code, to provide for the circumstances under which the Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall provide reimbursement for emergency ambulance services.

term.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

bill.summary:
Veterans Reimbursement for Emergency Ambulance Services Act or the VREASA
This bill directs the Department of Veterans Affairs to treat ambulance services as reimbursable emergency services if:
the ambulance request was made because of the sudden onset of a medical condition of such nature that a prudent layperson would have reasonably expected that a delay in seeking immediate medical attention would have been hazardous to the individual or could reasonably expect the absence of immediate medical attention to result in placing the individual in serious jeopardy, and the individual is transported to the closest and most appropriate medical facility capable of treating such emergency medical condition.
